conclusion: Analyze the v-t graphs to determine if the displacement difference is continuously increasing.
The v-t graph for object A starts at the origin, peaks before t1, and decreases back to zero at t1.
The v-t graph for object B starts at the origin, peaks before t1, and decreases back to zero at t1.
Displacement is the area under the v-t graph.
Displacement for object A is the area under its curve from 0 to t1.
Displacement for object B is the area under its curve from 0 to t1.
Difference in displacement is the difference in areas under the curves up to any time t.
Both objects start from rest, increase velocity, reach a maximum, then decrease back to zero.
Difference in displacement at any time t is the difference in areas under the curves from 0 to t.
Check if the difference in areas under the curves is always increasing.
If area under curve A is always greater than area under curve B for all t, displacement difference is continuously increasing.
Area under curve A is always greater than area under curve B for all t in the interval from 0 to t1.
Difference in displacement between the two objects is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
